qas.question: What are MBS as related to the housing and credit booms?
What are CDO as related to the housing and credit booms?
When housing prices declined, who reported significant losses from being heavily invested in subprime MBS?
Who could invest in the U.S. housing market through MBS and CDO?

answers.text: institutions and investors around the world

qas.question: MBS and CDO derive their value from?

context: As part of the housing and credit booms, the number of financial agreements called <a0_0>mortgage-backed securities<a0_0/> (MBS) and <a1_0>collateralized debt obligations<a1_0/> (CDO), which derived their value from <a4_0>mortgage payments and housing prices<a4_0/>, greatly increased. Such financial innovation enabled <a3_0>institutions and investors around the world<a3_0/> to invest in the U.S. housing market. As housing prices declined, <a2_0>major global financial institutions<a2_0/> that had borrowed and invested heavily in subprime MBS reported significant losses.
